M, CM, CD/T
") ids_info1 = 0 ;GENERATEXMLRES("M8 Class "Centurion" Corsair Very Heavy Fighter
Often called the "Hand of Mephisto," the original M4 Centurion distinguished itself in combat repeatedly. Despite these victories, the Corsairs continued to refine its basic design until the result was the M8 class, which honorably bears the same moniker. The new Centurion, therefore, has not been so much manufactured as bred to be a mighty ship in every way.

M, CM, CD/T
") ids_info1 = 0 ;GENERATEXMLRES("M11 Class "Praetorian" Corsair Advanced Very Heavy Fighter
The Corsairs' survival is rooted in their ability to survive and adapt, the Praetorian is no different. On the surface the design is somewhat visually similar to the M6 Class, however the power system is a revolutionary step forward and the armor rating is the heaviest available. This provides maximum offensive and defensive capabilities while still delivering speed and maneuverability. This ship is, in short, the one.

M, CM, CD/T
") ids_info1 = 0 ;GENERATEXMLRES("07A "Anubis" The Order Heavy Fighter
Built from the ground up by Orillion's Corps of Engineers, the Anubis is a one-of-a-kind class of ship. It has been completely outfitted for optimal performance in combat, with the best possible balance of power, armor, and weapon extensibility. It is used by The Order to infiltrate, secure, and, if need be, quickly dominate in hostile situations. Though it is not an easy ship to fly, in the hands of a skilled pilot the Anubis is unbeatable.

With crime on the rise, there has been resurgence in the Bounty Hunter trade. To hunt down a criminal one must think like a criminal and be armed like one too.
